hillbillies.part2.facade

Interface IFacade

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IFacade
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IFacade

    public interface IFacade
extends IFacade
    Implement this interface to connect your code to the graphical user interface (GUI).
    • For separating the code that you wrote from the code that was provided to you, put ALL your code in the src folder. The code that is provided to you stays in the src-provided folder. Only if you modify the provided code, it's advised to move the modified code to the src folder, so that your changes cannot be accidentally overwritten by an updated version of the provided code.
    • You should at least create the following classes in the package hillbillies.model:
      • a class Unit for representing a Hillbilly Unit
      • a class World for representing a Hillbilly World
      • a class Faction for representing a unit faction
      • a class Boulder for representing a boulder object
      • a class Log for representing a log object
      You may, of course, add additional classes as you see fit.
    • You should create a class Facade that implements this interface. This class should be placed in the package hillbillies.part2.facade in your src folder.
    • The header of that Facade class should look as follows:
      public class Facade implements IFacade { ... }
      Consult the Java tutorial for more information on interfaces, if necessary.
    • Your Facade class should offer a default constructor.
    • Each non-deprecated method defined in this IFacade interface and the interface from part 1 ( IFacade) must be implemented by your @{link Facade} class. For example, the implementation of IFacade.getCubeCoordinate(Unit) should call one or more methods on the given unit to retrieve its current cube coordinate.
    • The methods advanceTime(Unit, double) and work(Unit) from part 1 are deprecated and no longer need to be implemented.
    • Methods in this interface are only allowed to throw exceptions of type ModelException (this class is provided). No other exception types are allowed. This exception can only be thrown if (1) calling a method of your Unit class with the given parameters would violate a precondition, or (2) if the method of your Unit class throws an exception (if so, wrap the exception in the ModelException).
    • ModelException should not be used anywhere outside of your Facade implementation.
    • Your Facade implementation should only contain trivial code (for example, calling a method, combining multiple return values into an array, creating @Value instances, catching exceptions and wrapping it in a ModelException). All non-trivial code should be placed in the other classes that you create.
    • The rules described above and the documentation described below for each method apply only to your Facade class. Your other classes (e.g., Unit, World) should follow the rules described in the assignment.
    • Do not modify the signatures of the methods defined in this interface.

    • Method Detail

      • createWorld

        World createWorld(int[][][] terrainTypes,
                  TerrainChangeListener modelListener)
           throws ModelException
        Create a new world of the given size and with the given terrain. To keep the GUI display up to date, the method in the given listener must be called whenever the terrain type of a cube in the world changes.
        Parameters:
        terrainTypes - A three-dimensional array (structured as [x][y][z]) with the types of the terrain, encoded as integers. The terrain always has the shape of a box (i.e., the array terrainTypes[0] has the same length as terrainTypes[1] etc.). The integer types are as follows:
        • 0: air
        • 1: rock
        • 2: tree
        • 3: workshop
        modelListener - An object with a single method, TerrainChangeListener.notifyTerrainChanged(int, int, int) . This method must be called by your implementation whenever the terrain type of a cube changes (e.g., as a consequence of cave-ins), so that the GUI will correctly update the display. The coordinate of the changed cube must be given in the form of the parameters x, y and z. You do not need to call this method during the construction of your world.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ModelException

      • advanceTime

        void advanceTime(World world,
                 double dt)
          throws ModelException
        Advance the state of the given world by the given time period.
        Parameters:
        world - The world for which to advance the time
        dt - The time period, in seconds, by which to advance the world's state.
        Throws:
        ModelException - A precondition was violated or an exception was thrown.
        Note:
        This method replaces the {@link #advanceTime(Unit, double)} method from part 1.

      • getCubeType

        int getCubeType(World world,
                int x,
                int y,
                int z)
         throws ModelException
        Return the terrain type of the cube at the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        world - The world from which to retrieve the type.
        x - The x-coordinate of the cube
        y - The y-coordinate of the cube
        z - The z-coordinate of the cube
        Returns:
        The terrain type of the given cube, encoded as an integer according to the values in {@link #createWorld(int[][][], TerrainChangeListener)}.
        Throws:
        ModelException - A precondition was violated or an exception was thrown.

      • setCubeType

        void setCubeType(World world,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int z,
                 int value)
          throws ModelException
        Set the terrain type of the cube at the given coordinates the given value.
        Parameters:
        world - The world in which to set the type.
        x - The x-coordinate of the cube
        y - The y-coordinate of the cube
        z - The z-coordinate of the cube
        value - The new value of the terrain type of the cube, encoded as an integer according to the values in createWorld(int[][][], TerrainChangeListener).
        Throws:
        ModelException - A precondition was violated or an exception was thrown.

      • isSolidConnectedToBorder

        boolean isSolidConnectedToBorder(World world,
                                 int x,
                                 int y,
                                 int z)
                          throws ModelException
        Return whether the cube at the given coordinates is solid and connected to the border of the world.
        Parameters:
        world - The world to which the cube belongs
        x - The x-coordinate of the cube
        y - The y-coordinate of the cube
        z - The z-coordinate of the cube
        Returns:
        true if the given cube is solid and connected to the border of the world; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ModelException - A precondition was violated or an exception was thrown.

      • spawnUnit

        Unit spawnUnit(World world,
               boolean enableDefaultBehavior)
        throws ModelException
        Spawn a new unit in the world, according to the rules in the assignment (section 1.1.2).
        Parameters:
        world - The world in which to spawn a new unit
        enableDefaultBehavior - Whether the unit should act according to the default behaviour or not.
        Returns:
        The newly spawned unit, or null if no unit could be spawned.
        Throws:
        ModelException - A precondition was violated or an exception was thrown.
